title: Elbridge Gerry
summary: Elbridge Gerry (/ˈɡɛri/; July 17, 1744 (OS July 6, 1744) – November 23, 1814) was an American Founding Father, politician, and diplomat who served as the fifth Vice President of the United States under President James Madison from 1813 until his death in 1814.  The political practice of gerrymandering is named after him. He was the second U.S vice president to die in office.
